result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Demond Anderson Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $140.00 payable to the West Allis Police Department. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

EACH COUNT: Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: with 78 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.

superMiscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Concurrent with: with 78 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (19 pages) commencing 02/16/2016 SENTENCE HEARING NAME OF PROCEEDINGS received and filed.

Defendant Marcus Demond Anderson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Marcus Demond Anderson in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIES defense motion to adjourn sentencing.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS with 78 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS with 78 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $140.00 payable to the West Allis Police Department; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Marcus Demond Anderson not in court, in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Sentencing hearing.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marcus Demond Anderson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for jury trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  As to Counts 1 & 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marcus Demond Anderson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 22 on 11/30/2015 at 9:00am.  State keeps their offer open until 11/27/2015 at 4:30pm.

Defendant Marcus Demond Anderson in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Court grants Defense motion for adjourned final pre-trial.  
BRANCH 22 WILL ACCEPT CASE 2015CF004529 FOR GLOBAL RESOLUTION ONLY.  IF ANY CASE PROCEEDS TO JURY TRIAL 2015CF004529 WILL RETURN TO BRANCH 38.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case is currently scheduled for Jury Trial on 09/28/2015, however Branch 22 will not be in session for the majority of that week, new dates for final pre-trial and jury trial are chosen.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
